definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: B: Here is a cheque for twenty thousand dollars for the deposit.
sentences.chinese: 這是訂金，二萬塊的支票。

sentences.english: If you want to take an order , you must draw a check.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想訂貨，你必須開支票給你方作訂金。

sentences.english: Party A shall deliver the goods within 30 working days after receiving the subscription of Party B.
sentences.chinese: 甲方收到乙方訂金後，30個工作日內交貨。

sentences.english: A 30% deposit is required for cake ordered over 2 lbs.
sentences.chinese: 如訂購超過2磅之蛋糕，貴客須先付3成訂金。

sentences.english: First,you will sign a preliminary rental agreement with the management office and pay the deposit.
sentences.chinese: 先與本公司籤一份臨時租約並交訂金。

sentences.english: Please pay the deposit along with the form to have your room reserved.
sentences.chinese: 使用本表申請者，須先繳付訂金，方得保留牀位。

sentences.english: How do you like to pay for your deposit?
sentences.chinese: 您要採取什麼形式付訂金？

sentences.english: The undersigned buyers agree to pay a 5,000 pound deposit .
sentences.chinese: 已簽名的買主同意支付5，000英鎊的訂金。

sentences.english: Will you please pay a deposit?
The hotel requires a deposit for all advance bookings.
sentences.chinese: 旅館規定凡預訂房間都要先付訂金。

sentences.english: He deposited a small amount of money toward the purchase of the car.
sentences.chinese: 他爲買這輛汽車先付了少量訂金。

definition: to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to transfer ownership (of a vehicle, securities etc)/(real estate) conveyancing
to demand payment of money owing
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
to break a promise/breach of contract
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
to quote a price/seller's first offer
